title: For Sale:  Outstanding Custom Tactical Autoloading 12 gauge CHEAP
postcontent:
The Remington 1100 Tactical 2 is, arguably, one of the finest combat shotguns ever made. I researched it thoroughly before purchasing this. It is more reliable than a Saiga and more durable than a Mossberg. Short 18" barrel with a 6+1 capacity, and you can reload between shots without needing to change magazines. Being gas-operated with a steel receiver it is one of the lightest recoiling 12 gauge shotguns ever made, and it blows fist sized holes in things as fast as you can pull the trigger.  This is a very well thought out design.

The prior owner purchased it new and had some custom work done to it to make it even better:
*Mesa Tactical Urbano stock with adjustable cheek riser and Limbsaver recoil pad.
*Mesa Tactical 6-round side saddle with Picatinny rail if you want to mount an optic.
*Nordic Components charging handle.
*Nordic Components mag clamp (a mini-rail can be ordered for $17 to mount a flashlight on said clamp).
*Oversized safety installed by Bowers Tactical, who also polished the bolt release.
*Condor Tactical shotgun scabbard with gear pouch.
*Assorted small parts & cleaning kit.
*Manual & warranty card.

VERY LOW ROUND COUNT from the prior owner, mostly Federal birdshot. I've only owned this shotgun for a few weeks and have not fired it. This is an outstanding shotgun, but just not the right choice for me. Due to an injury I have difficulty handling an 8 pound assault weapon without a sling.

I was going to order the mini-tac rail for the mag clamp (part # TRL-BCT-150) to mount a flashlight and a Tru-Glo fiberoptic front sight, but never got around to it. I highly recommend these items to the new owner.  A red dot or holographic sight can be mounted on the top rail, or you can remove it and mount ghost rings.  Many possible options.   

I did, however, purchase a lot of buckshot: 6 unopened boxes of Winchester #1 Buck, 6 unopened boxes of Winchester Mil-Spec 00 Buck, and a pair of A-Zoom snap caps. That is 60 rounds of the BEST buckshot available, plus a pair of training rounds to practice reloads and dry fire.

    Manufacturer: Remington
    Model #: 1100 Tactical 2
    Type: Shotgun
    Finish: Blasted Black Oxide
    Sights: Ft: Bead
    Barrel Length: 18"
    Overall Length: 42.5"
    Weight: 7.75 lbs
    Caliber: 12 Gauge
    Capacity: 6+1
    Action: Semi-Automatic
    # of Mags: 2 Shot Extention
    Chokes: Improved Cylinder
    Receiver: Drilled & Tapped
    Chamber: 2.75"
    Features: Sling Swivel Studs

This shotgun is practically new and has nearly $500 in extras.

Asking only $800 CASH.

Not really looking for trades, but will consider fair and reasonable offers. I'm partial to 20 gauge doubles, .38 snubs, and quality single-stack 9mms. If someone has a short AR with collapsible stock that would work too.  

Colorado sale only.  Will not ship.  Will not travel too far beyond greater Denver area.  No bill of sale required, but must be a legal CO resident and not a dirtbag.

Thanks.

title: For Sale:  8 Gauge Percussion Fowling Gun
location: Williston, Aiken, Barnwell, Columbia, Columbia, South Carolina
postcontent:
Built by Williams & Powell in Liverpool, England, this 8-gauge fowling gun is a muzzle loaded, percussion fired shotgun.  The 8-gauge was the largest shoulder-fired gun that was made.  Larger gauges (6 and 4) were 'punt guns', mounted in boats and used to harvest ducks and geese.

This shotgun retains its original brass-tipped tamping rod, and is elaborately engraved on the metal as well as the walnut stock.  The stock is well worn, but has no cracks. Unrestored, but appears to need very little or no work to make it serviceable.  Has 42" barrel, and overall length is 59".  

Reply to this ad for pictures.

title: For Sale:  Sako 995 TRG-S 7mm STW
postcontent:
I am looking to sell my Sako 7mm STW to finance a new one. Nothing wrong with the old one, just building a new STW that is exactly what I've always wanted.

The rifle for sale is a Sako model 995 - Factory original - no upgrades or changes other than a trigger job (2lbs, breaks like glass). For those not familiar with this rifle, It is built on the TRG-S action, which is a 3 lug push feed design. It has a 26" medium contour free floated barrel, black synthetic monte carlo stock with a nice palm swell.  The action is a matte blue finish and the barrel & bolt handle are a high luster blue.  One feature I really like is the detachable box magazine which holds 4 rounds and is plenty long to seat bullets out there.  I bought it 10 years ago and have only shot 60 rounds through it, all factory loads.  Always functioned perfectly.  Gun is in 99.9% condition. For me this rifle was always a pleasure to shoot, recoil very manageable, probably due to the stock design.  I have 2 sets of Sako rings (med & high) that mate with the integral dovetail bases on the receiver. The rifle weighs 9.2 lbs with a brand new Leupold 4.5x14x40 matte VX3 CDS on it.  I would sell with or without the scope.

Rifle with 2 sets of rings rings - $995.00 OBO
Rifle with scope & rings - $1490.00 OBO

Colt  1911 Officers Model OACP .45 Enhanced
Colt Officers ACP model. 

It is the enhanced model. The enhanced model has the slanted slide serrations, lowered and flared ejection port, flat top slide, combat hammer, two piece recoil spring. 
Comes in it's original blue plastic case with paperwork. 
It has the 3.5 inch barrel. It is wearing silver alumagrips. Other than the grip change it is all original.

title: For Sale:  Winchester Model 70 .22-250
postcontent:
Took this in trade a few years ago.  This gun has the original factory open sights.   It has has what looks like high gloss Leupold base and high gloss Leupold rings that were professionally mounted.  I had Robert Parker of Parker Arms install a very nice aftermarket (riflebasix), two stage, fully adjustable trigger (cost was a little over $200.00) .  The Original, factory trigger is also included. This gun is in excellent condition.

Serial # puts the date of manufacture at 1970.

I shot one box of Hornady VMax 40gr through this gun (empty brass and box included).  Took 10 shots to zero my scope.  The next 10 shots at 200 yards went into a group that I could cover with a 50 cent piece.  To say I was amazed at the accuracy of this factory gun is an understatement.  I don't have a use for this gun and am tired of it just sitting in my safe.

The rings and mount are included, the brass is included and the two triggers are included.  The scope is not included.  Considering all the aftermarket additions to this gun I think $595.00 is a very fair price.  No trades at this time.  Thanks.

title: For Sale/Trade:  SP101 .357 magnum 3" barrel w/ upgrades
postcontent:
I bought this gun thinking I would start reloading for .357 but I've since changed my mind and want to switch to 9mm to save some money. 

I did a lot of research before buying this gun and came to the conclusion that this is one of the most versatile guns out there. It's HEAVY with a steel frame, so it's manageable even with full power .357 loads, and a dream to shoot with cheaper .38's. The 3 inch barrel has a longer sight radius for more accuracy and respectable velocities for defense loads, over the much more common 2" model. The weight and barrel length make this gun less than ideal for every day concealed carry, but for a gun that will see some range time I think they're necessary compromises.

This gun also has the upgrades to fix every complaint I've ever heard about the SP101. The spring has been replaced for a lighter DA trigger pull. The front sight has been replaced with a low profile night sight (fixed sight in the rear). The stock grips have been replaced with an extremely comfortable Hogue Monogrip. I still have the extra springs however the original grips have been misplaced. 

Gun comes in original box (which has been slightly modified to fit gun with aftermarket grip) with three speedloaders and some ammo and once-used .38 brass if you're a reloader. Cash price is $450 firm. I might be willing to trade for a GP100 or the right 9mm.

title: For Sale:  ***SOLD*** Safir Arms T14 .410ga Shotgun on PSA MOE Lower /w Extras
location: Kansas City, MO, Kansas City, Missouri
postcontent:
Selling my AR-Style Semi-Automatic Shotgun. This is a Safir Arms T14 .410ga Quad-Rail upper receiver on a Palmetto State Armory (PSA) Magpul MOE Edition complete lower receiver (Black).

My asking price is $700 OBO, which includes the following:

* The complete AR-15 shotgun chambered in 2.5" .410ga (upper and lower)
* One Magpul P-Mag chambered in 5.56x45/.223 (came with the PSA lower)
* One Factory 5-round .410ga 2.5" Magazine
* Four Factory 13-round   .410ga 2.5" Magazines
* Stag Arms aluminum charging handle (Black)
* Magpul MBUS Flip-up Sights (Front and Rear)
* "Swiss Pattern" Polymer Foregrip
* Tapco Interfuse Sling with quick-detach (Black)
* 13 boxes of Winchester Super X .410 2.5" Rifled Slugs (195 rounds)
* RedHead single rifle case

Note on Ammunition:
==============
These shotguns were originally imported by ATI, which also imported 36 caliber Turkish shotgun shells (.410 2.5"), and can picky when it comes to ammo because of the inconsistencies in exploded hull lengths of American-made shotgun ammunition.

The best ammunition to run through these guns is Winchester Super X .410 2.5" Rifled Slugs (X41RS5), and I'm including 13 boxes of it with the sale.

Care and Maintenance:
===============
Be sure to keep the gun well lubricated and use blue loctite on all threaded components and it will run fine.

Value breakdown:
============
PSA MOE Edition Lower $300
Safir Arms T14 Quad Rail Upper $400
T14 13-round mag x 4 $120 ($30 each)
Magpul MBUS Sight set $90
Stag Arms Charging Handle $17.50
Tapco Interfuse Sling System $35
ProMag Swiss Pattern Foregrip $14
Redhead Case $20
Winchester Super X 2.5" Shells, 195 Rounds (13 boxes) $182

Total Value: $1178.50


Payment:

title: For Sale:  KIMBER MODEL 82 US GOVERNMENT MODEL COMPETITION/TARGET 22
postcontent:
US GOVERNMENT 22 CAL COMPETITION/MATCH TARGET RIFLE IN 100% CONDITION, WITH ORIGINAL BOX, SIGHTS, PAPERWORK.

With the help of a big U.S. government contract, Kimber of Oregon has set out to change the situation. The firm won a contract to make 20,000.22 rimfire target rifles, all capable of firing .700" or smaller groups at 50 yds. with target ammunition. The loading platform of the singleshot Model 82 is inserted in the receiver and incorporates the ejector. The action is securely fastened to the stock by a pair of heavy screws; one through the rear of the steel trigger guard into the rear tang and the other through the handstop rail into the recoil lug. The recoil lug is dovetailed to the receiver, which is grooved to accept the rear sight. Most of the Australian-made rear sight components are steel, with the housing and mounting bar made of a non-ferrous alloy. The mounting base secures to the corresponding receiver dovetail with two heavy clamping screws. The entire mounting system appears abundantly secure and allows the sight to be removed and reinstalled with minimal impact change. The adjustment knobs are heavily grooved for easy turning and are located at the top and left side of the sight. Each is clearly marked for direction and scale, allowing easy return to any previous setting. The adjustments are faithful to their claimed 1/5 minute of angle (m.o.a.) increments. No backlash was noted. The front sight is of the standard globe type and is made of a non-ferrous alloy. The 10 interchangeable inserts and the screw-in sight face and back are steel. The three post sizes and seven apertures that make up the front sight insert set seem adequate for shooting at most ranges and under varying light conditions. The safety lever is typical of Kimber sporting .22s and is "rolled" on and off to positive stops. It cannot be applied unless the action is cocked. The bolt handle is not locked when the safety is applied. The trigger assembly is fully adjustable for weight of pull, overall travel and sear engagement. The three trigger adjusting screws (accessible after the barrelled action has been removed from the stock) are each provided with two locking screws. An inspection port allows viewing of the sear/trigger engagement. The instruction book states that rifles are shipped with triggers adjusted to a pull weight between 3.5 and 4.5 lbs., and that the trigger should not be adjusted to less than 2 lbs. Notwithstanding all that, the sample rifle tested at a very crisp 3 lbs., and no further adjustment was deemed necessary. The instructions further state that the rifle should not be dry-fired, but it may be uncocked by holding the trigger to the rear as the bolt is closed. The cylindrical 25" barrel, factoryfitted with three sight bases (for scope mounts and the front sight) has a diameter of .928". It has a 1 in 16" righthand twist and is completely freefloated. The manufacturer warns against the use of all types of Short, Long or hypervelocity cartridges. Match quality ammunition suggested. Three buttstock spacers allow the length of pull to be adjusted between 117/8" and 133/8". The fore-end's accessory rail accepts the factory-supplied round hand stop. Fit and finish were in keeping with other target arms in this price range. All metal parts were well polished and nicely blued. The walnut stock had some visible figure and a low-luster finish. The Kimber Model 82 was fired for accuracy, with results shown in the accompanying table, and function-fired with a variety of ammunition. There were no failures of any kind, and accuracy results showed the Kimber test rifle capable of staying within the 10ring of the 50-yd. and 50-meter targets used in conventional smallbore competition.

title: For Sale:  Ultimate Blaser Tactical 2 .338 LM
postcontent: New Blaser Tactical 2 chambered in .338 Lapua that has had 20 rounds through it. Currently it just sits in the safe and doesn't get the use that it is meant for. If you're wanting to make a 1500 yard shot or further then THIS is the perfect rifle for you. Another great feature is the fact that you can change calibers on this rifle to other popular sniper rounds in under two minutes. The barrels and bolts needed are available online. Below is some good info about the rifle, and if you have ANY questions please feel free to ask. ***I'll consider a partial trade for top tier 1911 and/or AR*** The Tactical 2 is the most advanced version of the precision rifle developed by Blaser. Each design element was driven by the requirement to create the best shooting platform possible. Exceptional accuracy was one of the key principles during development, with effective engagement ranges of 1500 meters or more, depending on caliber and ammunition. Advanced engineering and uncompromising quality are evident in every facet of design. The Tactical 2 is a bolt action rifle featuring Blaser’s revolutionary straight-pull action. When the bolt is closed, the 360 degree radial collet expands into the locking groove in the barrel – the bolt head is auto-centering and self-headspacing. The straight pull action features no rotating parts and assures rapid reloading with minimum movement. The rifle can easily be converted for left or right hand shooters. Interchange calibers by replacing the barrel and bolt head, in under a minute, without special tools and no change in accuracy. Barrels are cold hammer forged, fluted and plasma-nitrided to provide maximum resistance against corrosion and abrasion. An M1913 Picatinny rail is fixed to the barrel, ensuring full compatibility with a wide range of optical sighting systems. The muzzle end is threaded for an optional muzzle brake
